com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.emu

Class SessionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.emu.SessionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISessionStatusEventListener, ICatalysEventListener, EventListener

    public class SessionManager
extends Object
implements ISessionStatusEventListener
    A session manager for the EMX Hub Emulator. The session manager creates two threads, one for incoming and one for outgoing messages.
    Author:
    Christopher J Burton, 13/May/2005.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SessionManager.Factory
      We will use a Factory class to create a SessionManager when needed.

    • Method Detail

      • setFrozen

        public void setFrozen(boolean isFrozen)
        Causes the Session to behave similarly to if the network connection has become blocked. Useful for testing client applications.
        Parameters:
        isFrozen - frozen flag

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the Session and creates the incoming thread. There is no point in creating the outgoing thread until we are logged on.

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent(CatalysEventObject event)
        Implement this method of ISessionStatusEventListener so that we can receive receive event notification from our session object. We have called Session.addSessionStatusEventListener( this ) to register ourself to have this onEvent() method called. Note that it is important that all actions taken in the call to the onEvent method happen quickly, since the call is driven by the Fix message assembler thread.
        Specified by:
        onEvent in interface ICatalysEventListener

      • onInMessageReceived

        public void onInMessageReceived(CatalysEventObject event,
                                Object receivedData)

      • shouldReceiveHighVolumeEvents

        public boolean shouldReceiveHighVolumeEvents()
        Description copied from interface: ISessionStatusEventListener
        Some session events occur at high volume, i.e. per message. If this method returns false, then the Session can possibly avoid notifications for these events which improves performance.
        Specified by:
        shouldReceiveHighVolumeEvents in interface ISessionStatusEventListener
        Returns:
        whether high volume events should be delivered
